title: Purine Riboswitch Detection Feature
description: This feature primarily detects purine riboswitches in bacterial genomes. The activation pattern shows sharp, distinct spikes precisely at the riboswitch location. Purine riboswitches are non-coding RNA elements that regulate gene expression by changing conformation upon binding to purine molecules like guanine. They typically control genes involved in purine metabolism and transport. The feature shows remarkable consistency as sharp, isolated peaks rather than broad activations. While most prominent in firmicutes, it appears to detect this regulatory element across diverse bacterial phyla, highlighting conservation of this regulatory mechanism.
